pr_title: BLUEBUTTON 2001: Slow Coverage search with paging and identifiers

timeline.bodyText: All the changes happened in this method and the methods it calls.
timeline.author: RickHawesUSDS

timeline.bodyText: Moving to TypedQuery return type improves the readability of the caller.
timeline.author: RickHawesUSDS
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -353,31 +375,74 @@ private CcwCodebookVariable partDCwVariableFor(String system) {
    * @param joins to add for many-to-one relations
    * @return the criteria
    */
-  private CriteriaQuery<Beneficiary> queryBeneficiariesBy(
+  private TypedQuery<Beneficiary> queryBeneficiariesBy(
       SingularAttribute<Beneficiary, String> field,

timeline.bodyText: Refactoring the whereClause for readability. The select statement is now the same for both paging and non-paging cases.
timeline.author: RickHawesUSDS

timeline.bodyText: Although this whereClause is similar to the previous whereClause in the previous method. It is not. I tried to build a common function and it didn't work.
timeline.author: RickHawesUSDS

timeline.message:
Moved to using JPQL for the queries.

Easier to read because the java form has much more boilerplate.

timeline.bodyText: Switching over to the JPQL style for these queries. Easier to understand and read to my eyes. Simpler code as well.
timeline.author: RickHawesUSDS

replies.bodyText: I like this and is easier to read for me too!
replies.author: dtisza1

timeline.author: jzulim
